org.apache.ambari.server.scheduler

Class ExecutionScheduleManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.scheduler.ExecutionScheduleManager

  • public class ExecutionScheduleManager
extends Object
    This class handles scheduling request execution for managed clusters

      • pauseAfterBatchIfNeeded

        public void pauseAfterBatchIfNeeded(long executionId,
                                    long batchId,
                                    String clusterName)
                             throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Checks if scheduled request should be auto paused and updates the status to PAUSED if it does. For now the condition is following: the current status is SCHEDULED, it's the first batch and the pauseAfterFirstBatch flag is TRUE
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
